ygData.subject: Re: RE: RE: Re: Undead drops in Kithicor
ygData.msgSnippet: ... From: Corey de Danann  To:  Sent: Wednesday, November 03, 1999 11:08 AM Subject: [eqbards] RE: RE: Re: Undead drops
ygData.messageBody:
----- Original Message -----
From: Corey de Danann <corey@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Wednesday, November 03, 1999 11:08 AM
Subject: [eqbards] RE: RE: Re: Undead drops in Kithicor


> From: "Corey de Danann" <corey@...>
>
> I think you might be missing the point here. Qeynos Hills, which was the
> other undead spawn area, and Kithicor (to a lesser extent, were mostly for
> newbies btw 4-7 level. So said newbie in Qeynos heads for his normal
> hunting grounds and BAM, Varsoon the undying hits you for 47pts of damage.
> These 4-7 level players in Qeynos have no other place to hunt. I think
they
> have a right to complain that they lost their hunting area. RV residents
> still have Misty Thicket so should have less to complain about.


I think levels 4-7 can still hunt in Qeynos Hills even with the Undead
spawn. They may have to group more..but this is a group oriented game.
Also when I went to Qeynos Hills this past weekend..several times at
different times of the day..I never found it with less than 50 people in
zone. Warbones and Varsoon had groups on them within a few minutes..making
it less dangerous for the lower levels. I didn't hear any complaints from
lower level players..although there may have been some. It seemed to me
that most people were having a good time. Its a good sized zone..maybe they
could keep the undead north of the xroads and add a vendor south of the
xroads.


> No one is whining about dying in a fair fight. You know when you go into
> Unrest that you are taking your chances. But Q Hills? I am a level 15 Bard
> and made it safely through the Hills only because I had Selo's and my drum
> equipped. Incidently, I zoned into the Hills and immediately got hit by
> Varsoon, and this was at about 3 p.m. EQ time on Monday. It was crawling
> with undead, so during the day there was no respite in the Hills!
>
> Just thought I'd let you know
>
> Llyrean, Bard of the 15th Song
> Crimson Legacy
> Tailor, Baker, Brewer, Smith and Beauty Queen
> E'ci
>
